__e: You went in with his watch and blood and found him dead? Yes?
He asked me where i got my watch, and i told him my girlfriend gave it to me, okay?
But there's no clock, no light, no way he can know what time it is.
It's like the inside of a watch... only bigger.
I'm guessing that this is part of a wristwatch, but...
We're both wearing the same kind of wristwatch.
Cos that looks like a bloke's watch.
You give him a pocket watch that you got from someone who went to last weekend's party.
Well, I understand that, but this is a $45 watch.
So all these people have come here To see a clock that doesn't actually work?
My watch don't tell time, I tell it.
His and today you can listen to a clock - for three hours, five hours.
You are providing them with a clock, I hear.
Look, I don't mean to pry, but why would he leave his watch with you?
He is just a guy who left his watch at my apartment last night.
Not old, but you got that biological clock ticking, right?

I could take the stubbornness, really I could, and the substance abuse, and the lateness and the "cooler than school and all the rest of us" ne'er-do-well attitude, but the thing that absolutely got me was the unwarranted advice about my biological clock.
Has it ever occurred to you that you don't have a clock and can have children whenever you want?
